2025-01-15-getting-started.name: 2025-01-15-getting-started
2025-01-15-getting-started.title: Getting Started with Static Site Generation
2025-01-15-getting-started.description: Learn how to create and customize your static site
2025-01-15-getting-started.content:
# Getting Started with Static Site Generation

This is your second post, demonstrating more advanced features of the static site generator.

## What is a Static Site Generator?

A static site generator takes your content and templates, then generates a complete website as static HTML files. This approach offers several advantages:

- **Performance**: Static files load faster than dynamic pages
- **Security**: No server-side code means fewer vulnerabilities
- **Reliability**: Fewer moving parts means less can go wrong
- **Cost**: Can be hosted on simple file hosting services

## Key Features

### Markdown Support
Write your content in Markdown for easy formatting:

```markdown
# This is a heading
## This is a subheading

- Bullet point 1
- Bullet point 2

**Bold text** and *italic text*
```

### Front Matter
Each post can include metadata at the top:

```yaml
---
title: "Your Post Title"
date: "2025-01-15 14:30:00 +0000"
url: "your-post-url"
description: "A brief description"
tags: ["tag1", "tag2"]
language: "en"
---
```

### Template System
The generator uses Jinja2 templates for flexible page layouts.

## Next Steps

1. Explore the theme templates in `themes/default/templates/`
2. Customize the CSS in your site's `assets/css/` directory
3. Add more content and experiment with different post formats
4. Configure your site settings in the `config/` directory

Happy building!
2025-01-15-getting-started.html_content:
Getting Started with Static Site Generation

This is your second post, demonstrating more advanced features of the static site generator.

What is a Static Site Generator?

A static site generator takes your content and templates, then generates a complete website as static HTML files. This approach offers several advantages:

  • Performance: Static files load faster than dynamic pages
  • Security: No server-side code means fewer vulnerabilities
  • Reliability: Fewer moving parts means less can go wrong
  • Cost: Can be hosted on simple file hosting services

Key Features

Markdown Support

Write your content in Markdown for easy formatting:

```markdown

This is a heading

This is a subheading

  • Bullet point 1
  • Bullet point 2

Bold text and italic text ```

Front Matter

Each post can include metadata at the top:

```yaml

title: "Your Post Title" date: "2025-01-15 14:30:00 +0000" url: "your-post-url" description: "A brief description" tags: ["tag1", "tag2"] language: "en"

```

Template System

The generator uses Jinja2 templates for flexible page layouts.

Next Steps

  1. Explore the theme templates in themes/default/templates/
  2. Customize the CSS in your site's assets/css/ directory
  3. Add more content and experiment with different post formats
  4. Configure your site settings in the config/ directory

Happy building!

2025-01-01-welcome-post.name: 2025-01-01-welcome-post
2025-01-01-welcome-post.title: Welcome to DemoSite
2025-01-01-welcome-post.content:
# Welcome to DemoSite

This is your first post. You can edit this file to add your content.

## Getting Started

1. Edit this post in `sites\demosite\content\posts\2025\2025-01-01-welcome-post/2025-01-01-welcome-post.md`
2. Add images to the `images/` subdirectory
3. Customize your site configuration in `config/content.yml`
4. Run the generator to build your site

## Features

- Markdown support with front matter
- Automatic date processing
- Tag-based organization
- Multi-language support
- Responsive templates

Happy blogging!
2025-01-01-welcome-post.html_content:
Welcome to DemoSite

This is your first post. You can edit this file to add your content.

Getting Started

  1. Edit this post in sites\demosite\content\posts\2025\2025-01-01-welcome-post/2025-01-01-welcome-post.md
  2. Add images to the images/ subdirectory
  3. Customize your site configuration in config/content.yml
  4. Run the generator to build your site

Features

  • Markdown support with front matter
  • Automatic date processing
  • Tag-based organization
  • Multi-language support
  • Responsive templates

Happy blogging!

about.name: about
about.title: About DemoSite
about.content:
{% extends "base.html" %} {% block content %}

{{ doc.title or 'About DemoSite' }}

{{ doc.description or 'Learn more about DemoSite' }}

About This Site

This is a sample about page for your new site. You can customize this content.

Features

  • Static site generation with markdown support
  • Theme-based design system
  • Responsive templates
  • Multi-language support
  • Tag-based content organization

Contact

Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions or suggestions.

{% endblock %}

404.title: Page Not Found

feed.name: feed
feed.content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<rss version="2.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
    <channel>
        <atom:link href="{{ env.url }}/{{ doc.target_file or 'feed.xml' }}" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" />
        <title>{{ site.name }}</title>
        <link>{{ env.url }}</link>
        <description>
        {%- set current_lang = doc.language | default('en') -%}
        {%- set lang_config = languages.get(current_lang, {}) -%}
        {{ lang_config.site_description | default(site.description | default('Site RSS Feed')) }}
        </description>
        <language>
        {%- set lang_config = languages.get(current_lang, {}) -%}
        {{ lang_config.xml | default(site.lang_xml | default('en')) }}
        </language>
        {% if latest_post and latest_post.date_xml_feed %}
        <lastBuildDate>{{ latest_post.date_xml_feed }}</lastBuildDate>
        {% endif %}

        {% for post in posts %}
        {%- set post_lang = post.language | default('en') -%}
        {%- if post_lang == current_lang or (not doc.language and not post.language) -%}
        <item>
            <title>{{ post.title.replace("&", "&").replace("<", "<").replace(">", ">") }}</title>
            <link>{{ env.url }}/{{ post.url }}/</link>
            <description>{{ post.content.replace("&", "&").replace("<", "<").replace(">", ">") | safe -}}</description>
            <pubDate>{{ post.date_xml_feed }}</pubDate>
            <guid>{{ env.url }}/{{ post.url }}/</guid>
        </item>
        {% endif %}
        {% endfor %}
    </channel>
</rss>
feed.html_content:

<rss version="2.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">

        <description>
        {%- set current_lang = doc.language | default('en') -%}
        {%- set lang_config = languages.get(current_lang, {}) -%}
        {{ lang_config.site_description | default(site.description | default('Site RSS Feed')) }}
        </description>
        <language>
        {%- set lang_config = languages.get(current_lang, {}) -%}
        {{ lang_config.xml | default(site.lang_xml | default('en')) }}
        </language>
        {% if latest_post and latest_post.date_xml_feed %}
        <lastBuildDate>{{ latest_post.date_xml_feed }}</lastBuildDate>
        {% endif %}

        {% for post in posts %}
        {%- set post_lang = post.language | default('en') -%}
        {%- if post_lang == current_lang or (not doc.language and not post.language) -%}
        <item>
            <title>{{ post.title.replace("&", "&").replace("<", "<").replace(">", ">") }}</title>
            <link>{{ env.url }}/{{ post.url }}/</link>
            <description>{{ post.content.replace("&", "&").replace("<", "<").replace(">", ">") | safe -}}</description>
            <pubDate>{{ post.date_xml_feed }}</pubDate>
            <guid>{{ env.url }}/{{ post.url }}/</guid>
        </item>
        {% endif %}
        {% endfor %}
    </channel>
</rss>

en.description: Learn how to create and customize your static site
en.content:
# Getting Started with Static Site Generation

This is your second post, demonstrating more advanced features of the static site generator.

## What is a Static Site Generator?

A static site generator takes your content and templates, then generates a complete website as static HTML files. This approach offers several advantages:

- **Performance**: Static files load faster than dynamic pages
- **Security**: No server-side code means fewer vulnerabilities
- **Reliability**: Fewer moving parts means less can go wrong
- **Cost**: Can be hosted on simple file hosting services

## Key Features

### Markdown Support
Write your content in Markdown for easy formatting:

```markdown
# This is a heading
## This is a subheading

- Bullet point 1
- Bullet point 2

**Bold text** and *italic text*
```

### Front Matter
Each post can include metadata at the top:

```yaml
---
title: "Your Post Title"
date: "2025-01-15 14:30:00 +0000"
url: "your-post-url"
description: "A brief description"
tags: ["tag1", "tag2"]
language: "en"
---
```

### Template System
The generator uses Jinja2 templates for flexible page layouts.

## Next Steps

1. Explore the theme templates in `themes/default/templates/`
2. Customize the CSS in your site's `assets/css/` directory
3. Add more content and experiment with different post formats
4. Configure your site settings in the `config/` directory

Happy building!

left.title: Disclaimer
left.content: This is a sample disclaimer for your new site. You can customize this content.

subscribe.title: Subscribe
subscribe.description: Articles only. No spam. Cancel anytime.

after.privacy_notice: The site does not store any information about you or use cookies when you read articles. Suggestions, comments and questions can also be sent by
after.comment_notice: Note! Commenting uses cookies. Your name, email and website are saved to your browser so you can comment more easily in the future with the same information. Fields are optional and you can leave them empty if you wish.

comments.javascript_required: Enable Javascript if you want to participate in commenting.
